meanings.definition: Opposing or counteracting sagging or drooping.
meanings.sent1: The strong rope provided an antisag support for the heavy banner.
meanings.sent2: The new reinforced material had excellent antisag properties.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's cape was specially made with an antisag fabric to avoid any embarrassing moments while flying.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude acted as an invisible antisag force, lifting the spirits of everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The magic potion promised to give her an antisag appearance, defying the laws of gravity.

meanings.definition: A substance or device used to prevent sagging.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter used a sturdy antisag brace to support the shelf.
meanings.sent2: She applied the special antisag cream to her skin to maintain its firmness.
meanings.sent3: The inflatable antisag pillow kept his head comfortably elevated during the long flight.
meanings.sent4: The ancient artifact was protected by an antisag shield to preserve its shape over time.
meanings.sent5: The engineer designed a revolutionary antisag mechanism to keep the bridge from bending under heavy loads.

meanings.sent1: She diligently worked out to antisag her muscles and maintain a toned physique.
meanings.sent2: The tailor carefully antisagged the hem of the dress to ensure it stayed straight.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly claimed he could antisag time itself if given the chance.
meanings.sent4: The motivational speaker inspired the audience to antisag their spirits and stand tall in the face of adversity.
meanings.sent5: The gardener used special techniques to antisag the plants and keep them upright in the wind.
